sentence.Network_en: He appears to have the votes he needs to prevail.
sentence.Network_cn: 他似乎已经获得了取胜所需的选票。

means.word_mean: 劝说,劝导,刺激;施加压力

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin praevalere 'have greater power', from prae 'before' + valere 'have power'

entry.tran: （提议、原则、观点）占上风，占优势，获胜，被接受
entry.def: If a proposal, principle, or opinion prevails, it gains influence or is accepted, often after a struggle or argument.

example.ex: We hope that common sense would prevail...
example.tran: 我们希望情理会占上风。

example.ex: Rick still believes that justice will prevail...
example.tran: 里克仍然相信正义会得以伸张。

entry.tran: （情形、态度、风俗）盛行，流行，普遍
entry.def: If a situation, attitude, or custom prevails in a particular place at a particular time, it is normal or most common in that place at that time.

example.ex: A similar situation prevails in America...
example.tran: 相似的情况在美国随处可见。

example.ex: ...the confusion which had prevailed at the time of the revolution...
example.tran: 在革命期间普遍存在的混乱

entry.tran: （在战斗、竞赛、争论中）获胜，取胜
entry.def: If one side in a battle, contest, or dispute prevails, it wins.

example.ex: He appears to have the votes he needs to prevail...
example.tran: 他似乎已经获得了取胜所需的选票。

example.ex: I do hope he will prevail over the rebels.
example.tran: 我确实希望他能战胜叛乱者。

entry.def: If you prevail upon someone to do something, you succeed in persuading them to do it.

example.ex: We must, each of us, prevail upon our congressman to act...
example.tran: 我们每一个人都必须说服我们各自的国会议员采取行动。

example.ex: Do you think she could be prevailed upon to do those things?
example.tran: 你觉得有可能说服她去做那些事情吗？

means.word_mean: 1. be larger in number, quantity, power, status or importance;

sentences.sentence: "The champion prevailed, though it was a hard fight"
"He prevailed upon her to visit his parents"

auth_sentence.content: We will prevail over this destruction, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content: We will prevail over this destruction, he said.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We will prevail over this destruction, he said.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe there is some common sense starting to prevail.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe there is some common sense starting to prevail.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe there is some common sense starting to prevail.

auth_sentence.content: We believe,however, that truth eventually prevail.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We believe,however, that truth eventually prevail.

Sentence.sentence: They weren't looking for cured meats, organic produce or beautiful presentation; they were looking for whatever they could get their hands on, and this prioritisation of quantity over quality prevailed for decades, meaning a generation was brought up with food that couldn't compete with neighbouring France, Italy, Belgium or Spain.

sentences.en: Justice has prevailed; the guilty man has been punished.
sentences.cn: 正义得到伸张, 罪犯受到惩罚。

jushi.english: Justice has prevailed; the guilty man has been punished.
jushi.chinese: 正义得到伸张,罪犯受到惩罚。
